user_request: A poem where the speaker hears America singing, each worker their own song.
final_poem:
In fields of emerald green and gold arrayed with ease,  
A chorus forms in every toil-laden breeze;   
From dawn till night's embrace is tenderly spread within earshot wide—    
America sings on shoulders strong as sturdy oak. 

The farmer humming hymns of soil that feeds,  
A serene refrain the rustling wheat repeats;   
His hands in earth’th yoke he finds his worthwhile plea—     
“I till and toil for sustenance.”    
Through sun's blaze or rainfall sprayed with ease,  
Intoxicating is the farmer's steady song.   
His labor yields a golden sea that feeds; 
Beneath starlight’s glow in which dreamers strive—    
Lullabies of hope and future bright he sings to be free:        “It dawned, day broke new.”  
Upon the seaside docks where fishermen stand strong with ease.   
With every splash their hearts sing a sea-bound tale;      "Here I am homeward bound!”     The salty tides on which they sail bring forth songs of heartfelt plea, “From depths to daylight's light”—these mariners brave and bold. Their nets bear the ocean’s unseen gold:       Each catch a victory forged in hardship fought;        And yet within their chests beats rhythm pure as bellflower bloom under open sky, “From darkness to dawn.”  
In bustling cities where workers' voices rise high—     Amidst the clanging of industry’s song.       Forged iron echoes in factory hall;  From sweat and spark there is no room for sigh:      "I labor with heart, I earn my bread,”  
Their anthem bold amid noise's din - a testament to tenacity true—     Their dreams are steeled within the furnace of life.       In every task their spirit stands aloof from greed’s siren song;    Each note sung is strength forged in unity as they join hands together:  “From sunrise till dusk,” through struggle,  
They craft a nation's chorus that echoes ever on—"With every breath I draw."
